eip_8105_updates.highlight: Two-slot execution design: encrypted tx (block N) + decrypted tx (block N+1)
Execution context references previous block to prevent builder communication
Envelope signer reference added to prevent envelope stripping attacks
EIP-8105 PR merged yesterday with all new changes

gas_metering_design.highlight: Encrypted tx consumes all gas; decrypted tx consumes none
Gas charged at block N prices for execution in block N+1
Builder knows next block base fee; no dangerous incentives identified

lucid_design.highlight: Gas limit set to 1/8 block for sealed transactions (was 1/4 in research)
Limit ensures two payloads fit if one missing (liveness guarantee)
Non-guaranteed bundling via same top-of-block fee; deterministic bundling possible later

organizational.highlight: First kickoff call; focus on stabilizing EIP-8105 and Lucid specs
Lucid EIP expected in a few more days

action_items.action: Review gas metering approach and compare with Lucid design
Analyze real-world block data: shuffle private mempool txs to test ordering dependencies
Open GitHub issue for next meeting agenda items
